page.title: 02Historical Buildings & Sites
page.content: There are a number of interesting buildings and sites in the area. {Norbury Hall,}the home of the Hyde family used to stand on a part of what is now Norbury farm.{Poynton Hall was the home of the Vernon Family and stood where Poynton Pool is now. { Norbury Chapel of Ease}was built before 1600. It was pulled down in 1834 when the new church of St.Thomas was consecrated. It was sited where the gardens at the back of the houses in Darley Road abut the field beyond. There are a number of disused coal Mines in the area,in Hazel Grove, in High Lane and in Poynton,they all ceased about 1900. At 113 Chester Road there is the last remaining{thatched cottage}in the area
